definition: to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to draw back the corners of one's mouth

sentences.english: He winced as she stood on his injured foot .
sentences.chinese: 她踩着他受傷的腳，他疼得齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: His face was set in a rictus of death that was somewhat like a smile.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉擺出死亡的齜牙咧嘴，有點像在微笑。

sentences.english: He winced as a sharp pain shot through his left leg.
sentences.chinese: 他左腿一陣劇痛疼得他直齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: If you cannot bite never shou your teeth.
sentences.chinese: 不會咬人，切莫齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: He looks fierce by showing his teeth to scare children.
sentences.chinese: 他總是齜牙咧嘴嚇唬小孩。

sentences.english: He winced as the dog nipped his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 狗咬了他的腳腕子，疼得他齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: Self-expansion, show its teeth, insufferably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 自我膨脹，齜牙咧嘴，不可一世。

sentences.english: The bandit bared his teeth in an insolent smile.
sentences.chinese: 那匪徒齜牙咧嘴地獰笑。

definition: bell made of copper or bronze
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to wail at a funeral/formal wailing while offering sacrifice to the departed
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
